sentences.cn: 一种倾向掩盖另一种倾向

sentences.en: For then there is no other motive left except mutual inclination.
sentences.cn: 到那时,除了相互的爱慕以外,就再也不会有别的动机了.

sentences.en: He had shown an inclination, from the first, to go his own way.
sentences.cn: 他一开始就表现出我行我素的倾向.

sentences.en: He is a teacher by occupation but a philosopher by inclination.
sentences.cn: 他的职业是教师,但他的本心是成为哲学家.

sentences.en: He is ready to sacrifice inclination to his country.
sentences.cn: 为了祖国的利益他乐于牺牲个人所好.

sentences.en: I have no inclination to be a doctor.
Monkeys have a natural inclination for climbing.
My natural inclination was to say no.
She greeted Maggie with an inclination of the head.
She greeted us with a slight inclination of the head.
sentences.cn: 她微微点头向我们致意.

sentences.en: She has no inclination towards mysticism.
sentences.cn: 她一点也不倾向于神秘主义.

sentences.en: She was married -- married against her inclination to my brother.
sentences.cn: 她结婚了 -- 违反她本人的意志和我哥哥结婚了.

sentences.en: Their inclination to wait and demand more resources desolated President Lincoln.
sentences.cn: 他们总是等待并要求得到更多资财的倾向让林肯总统甚感不快。

sentences.en: There is always a certain inclination in a ship's deck.
sentences.cn: 船的甲板总有几分斜度.

sentences.en: This young man had all the inclination to be a profligate of the first water.
sentences.cn: 这个青年完全有可能成为十足的浪子.

sentences.en: While the inclination to procrastinate is common, one must fully consider the detrimental impact of unnecessary delays.
sentences.cn: 虽然拖延的倾向是普遍的, 但是人们应该充分考虑到不必要的延误造成的有害影响.

words.tran_cn: 倾斜；倾向（incline的ing形式）；点头弯腰

trans.tran_en: a feeling that makes you want to do something
